text: Kona is a department or commune of Mouhoun Province in western Burkina Faso. Its capital lies at the town of Kona. According to the 1996 census the department has a total population of 18,033.Burkinabé government inforoute communale ==Towns and villages== * Kona (2 704 inhabitants) (capital) * Blé (767 inhabitants) * Dafina (1 590 inhabitants) * Dangouna (1 158 inhabitants) * Goulo (458 inhabitants) * Kouana (1 488 inhabitants) * Lah (3 239 inhabitants) * Nana (1 057 inhabitants) * Pie (1 690 inhabitants) * Sanfle (564 inhabitants) * Soungoule (320 inhabitants) * Tâ (650 inhabitants) * Tena (422 inhabitants) * Tona (1 005 inhabitants) * Yankoro (115 inhabitants) * Yoana (568 inhabitants) * Zina (238 inhabitants) ==References== Category:Departments of Burkina Faso Category:Mouhoun Province
title: Kona Department
